014package org.jdbi.v3.core.extension;
015
016import java.util.List;
017import java.util.Optional;
018import java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList;
019
020import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.JdbiConfig;
021import org.jdbi.v3.meta.Beta;
022
023/**
024 * Configuration class for defining {@code Jdbi} extensions via {@link ExtensionFactory}
025 * instances.
026 */
027public class Extensions implements JdbiConfig<Extensions> {
028    private final List<ExtensionFactory> factories = new CopyOnWriteArrayList<>();
029    private boolean allowProxy = true;
030
031    /**
032     * Create an empty {@link ExtensionFactory} configuration.
033     */
034    public Extensions() {}
035
036    /**
037     * Create an extension configuration by cloning another
038     * @param that the configuration to clone
039     */
040    private Extensions(Extensions that) {
041        allowProxy = that.allowProxy;
042        factories.addAll(that.factories);
043    }
044
045    /**
046     * Register an extension factory.
047     * @param factory the factory to register
048     * @return this
049     */
050    public Extensions register(ExtensionFactory factory) {
051        factories.add(0, factory);
052        return this;
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Returns true if an extension is registered for the given type.
057     *
058     * @param extensionType the type to query.
059     * @return true if a registered extension handles the type.
060     */
061    public boolean hasExtensionFor(Class<?> extensionType) {
062        return findFactoryFor(extensionType).isPresent();
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * Create an extension instance if we have a factory that understands
067     * the extension type which has access to a {@code Handle} through a {@link HandleSupplier}.
068     * @param <E> the extension type to create
069     * @param extensionType the extension type to create
070     * @param handle the handle supplier
071     * @return an attached extension instance if a factory is found
072     */
073    public <E> Optional<E> findFor(Class<E> extensionType, HandleSupplier handle) {
074        return findFactoryFor(extensionType)
075                .map(factory -> factory.attach(extensionType, handle));
076    }
077
078    private Optional<ExtensionFactory> findFactoryFor(Class<?> extensionType) {
079        return factories.stream()
080                .filter(factory -> factory.accepts(extensionType))
081                .findFirst();
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Find the registered factory of the given type, if any
086     * @param <F> the factory type to find
087     * @param factoryType the factory's type to find
088     * @return the found factory, if any
089     */
090    public <F extends ExtensionFactory> Optional<F> findFactory(Class<F> factoryType) {
091        return factories.stream()
092                .filter(factoryType::isInstance)
093                .map(factoryType::cast)
094                .findFirst();
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * Allow using {@link java.lang.reflect.Proxy} to implement extensions.
099     * @param allowProxy whether to allow use of Proxy types
100     * @return this
101     */
102    @Beta
103    public Extensions setAllowProxy(boolean allowProxy) {
104        this.allowProxy = allowProxy;
105        return this;
106    }
107
108    /**
109     * Returns whether Proxy classes are allowed to be used.
110     *
111     * @return whether Proxy classes are allowed to be used.
112     */
113    @Beta
114    public boolean isAllowProxy() {
115        return allowProxy;
116    }
117
118    @Override
119    public Extensions createCopy() {
120        return new Extensions(this);
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * Throw if proxy creation is disallowed.
125     */
126    @Beta
127    public void onCreateProxy() {
128        if (!isAllowProxy()) {
129            throw new IllegalStateException("Creating onDemand proxy disallowed. Ensure @GenerateSqlObject annotation is being processed by `jdbi3-generator` annotation processor.");
130        }
131    }
132}
